website_summaries.verdict: Simple, inexpensive option for those in need of a single, quality cordless phone.
pros: Conveniently sized cordless phone plus base is easy to set up anywhere in the home
Features DECT 6.0 tech, calling waiting, caller ID, and 30-entry directory
cons: Does not include answering machine or speaker phone

customer_reviews.title: Does not work when having to use keypad entries
customer_reviews.text: I have to make a lot of calls to doctors offices as my son has a medical condition which means a lot of "press 1 for (insert doctors name here)". However, no matter which offices I call or which numbers I have to press, it does not register on the other end so I can never get through to anyone from my house number.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Good Phone for a Great Price!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this specific cordless phone because I decided to get a home phone once more. I decided on this one which is without the answering machine because I like the price. I also like that it was available in different colors. This phone fits my needs exactly. It is easy to use and extremely affordable as well. I actually bought this same phone (in white) as a present for my mother. Her phone has the answering machine included. She also likes her phone a lot too! She uses it on a daily basis and has no complaints about it!
customer_reviews.author: ChelB

customer_reviews.title: Unable to Hear
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to have a cordless phone for my landline. I didn't want anything fancy, just a basic phone. I have the volume turned all the way and the sound quality and loudness are not acceptable. I have tried to use this phone for local and long distance calls and cannot recommend it due to the poor quality of ability to hear and talk with this handset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: If you just want a good cheap phone this is it. No answer machine, but that works great with something like Magic Jack. If you go any cheaper you get a corded phone so you may as well go with this. The only criticism I have is that the best is very light and doesn't stay put if you are sloppy when docking the phone. Ok one more, the wires are black and unsightly, white would have been better. At this price it's a steal.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: We only got this phone as a replacement for another phone that broke after 6 years. We keep a land line for emergencies, but we usually turn the ringer off because we never use the phone. This particular model is not worth wasting your money. The phone does not have a way to turn off the ringer. Only lower the ringer/phone volume. And you can only do that WHILE actually using the phone. Also the digital font is very small and not back-lit well. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ted C. in MD

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I have a better set of VTECH phones that do it all and with quality. This phone underwhelms me. It is slow to dial, doesn't have a speaker and is cheaply made over all. I never should have bought this phone and spent a little more to get one with quality! Should you need an extra phone, spend the extra few dollars and get a good phone and forget this one!
customer_reviews.author: hotchops57

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this - randomly becomes non-responsive & button LAG annoying asf.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, the return window just closed on this item, or I'd return it. Defect #1: Phone keeps "freezing" (non-responsive to keypress) & requires battery remove/replace to "unfreeze" it. Defect #2: the button LAG is like something you bought in 1983 -- Press button, wait 0.5 seconds for it to register, proceed with next button. You may think this LAG thing sounds like a petty gripe ... until you try and use it. Seriously, do not get this. Instant e-waste.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bucktwo

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE AND GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: The phone is not bulky and has easy to use instructions of the many features it has. The volume is good for me but could be adjusted higher if necessary. The ring can be changed to whatever tone you like and the phone lights up when picked up or when dialing a number. The key pad is easy to use and see when it lights up in the dark. When it is not in use I keep it on the stand to avoid draining the battery. The phone can function with voice mail depending on the phone company.
customer_reviews.author: Tio Ramon

customer_reviews.title: BEST Landline Wall Phone
customer_reviews.text: We needed something simple, but specific: a landline, cordless, push-button, white, wall-hanging phone with the ability to turn the ringer off. This is it! You will literally pull this phone out of the box, plug it in, and set it on the wall. Assuming you are just replacing your other wall-hanging phone, then you just use the same hanger already on the wall. It's very comfortable in your hand and on your ear! It's super simple to use. Plus, by keeping your landline you ensure your safety and security. What else could you want in a phone? Bonus feature, which we've not had before: it has caller ID (displays the number that is calling).
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Beware no speaker button on  the phone I took it they all had it I will be careful in the future.
customer_reviews.text: I like nothing about this phone, just had to replace a really good Vtec phone quickly and purchase this one it has a lot of static when you talk no speaker button basic ringtones I guess you get what you pay for it could have been a little better. I will be buying a real phone sooner than later. don't waste your money on this one
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Hoard

customer_reviews.title: Basic Phone
customer_reviews.text: If base unit is unplugged phone has to be completely recharged. Have not been able to find a button to turn the ringer off on this unit and I work night shift so I unplug it during the day while I sleep. Even though I charged it for 24 hours it is completely dead when I plug it back in an cannot make calls even though I haven’t used it at all. When I did use it there was a lot of static not sure if it is the phone or the modem hook up style service.
customer_reviews.author: Emiley H Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Met My Low Expectations
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much from a $12 phone. I just needed a phone with caller ID for my workshop. This fit the bill. Sound quality is actually very good. Initial set-up is power-on driven so if you need to start over you will need to disconnect the battery, then reconnect it. I could not get the Menu to go anywhere but Directory. The biggest drawback is that it DOES NOT fit a STANDARD wall plate. I had to jury rig a third stand-off pin to my wall plate. If it works a couple years I will be happy. Not sure of battery life since it is brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: basic home phone
customer_reviews.text: This is your most basic home phone with wireless. Basic is by definition....few features. This thing works and does basic phone calls with basic operational features. Its that simple and low cost and it works. The End. Great for simplicity and or places where if the item gets damaged its not a big deal. Good basic phone.
customer_reviews.author: JoeAverage-User

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy a landline for work due to COVID and purchased this product because of the price. I've had no issues with sound. I can go two days with it off the charger with frequent user before it dies. I should not that there is not an option for speaker phone but other than that, definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: V-Tech-A Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: I already owned five V-Tech phones so I know how good they perform. I had one in storage because my grandson did not want a house phone in his room. When he moved out recently I pulled the phone out of storage, charged the battery and put it back in service. So, I know have six phones (a phone in every major room in my house). I find V-Tech phones to give quality service and have attractive features. As far as I am concerned I am a satisfied customer. Bill J. Nix
customer_reviews.author: Bill J. Nix

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid attention to the numerous reviews complaining about the hard-to-read display. The LCD numbers on the display are so dim it's nearly impossible to read; I can't believe that technology perfected more than two decades ago could still be flawed on this device. I would have sent the thing back, but fortunately it's not my main device. And besides, it's not Amazon's fault -- I was forewarned and bought the danged thing anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jerry

customer_reviews.title: This phone did NOT work anywhere that I tried to set it up in my house.
customer_reviews.text: This phone did not work. I spent a lot of time looking for the packaging to return it. I assumed that the phone would work so I threw away the packaging when I received the phone. I was making an attempt to return the item and I saw that the return date has past. I guess that I am just out of my money. As a senior on a fixed income I really don't have money to throw away like this.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Young

customer_reviews.title: NO SPEAKERPHONE BUT DECENT DEVICE
customer_reviews.text: Typical cordless phone good for use here and there HAS NO SPEAKER feature so you have to keep the phone to your ear and that’s annoying. Forgot to check for that when I purchased but overall it a decent phone, also I was confused as to what comes in the box so what came in the box was everything needed the base the phone the wire to plug in socket and phone jack, so that was a plus thumbs up for that other than the speakerphone I don’t have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Shopgirl24

customer_reviews.title: Speaker too quiet, sound delay
customer_reviews.text: I had this thing for a few weeks. I tried to like it, but I just have to send it back. The speaker is so quiet, even with the volume all the way up, I can't hear the people on the other end. And I have fantastic hearing. Also, when you poke a button to dial the number, there's a delay in the sound of the button being pushed, so I never knew if the button got pushed or not. This made dialing really slow and a guessing game. I also couldn't find a speaker phone option. It's going back.
customer_reviews.author: B. Krok

customer_reviews.title: No speaker phone, not very loud - 1st day
customer_reviews.text: didn't have a home phone since 2007. Our ISP includes it in our package. I thought home phones would've improved. But nothing has changed. Its not terrible but the same. Display is the same size , back lit and small. I assumed there was a speaker phone since every phone I used, had it. Its worth the price, in the past it would've cost double. VTech just as I remembered
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Gen X

customer_reviews.title: Not Great
customer_reviews.text: Says it's a wall phone, but it really shouldn't be used on the wall. It's way too easy to knock the phone out of the cradle. If you have an old metal plate on the wall that the phone is suppose to mount to, this won't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Karen SimonsonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Overall good, could use improvement
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the display on my old phone was so dim as to be unreadable. This is much easier to read. The old phone did have one advantage: a red light flashed on the base if I had voicemail waiting. I miss that feature. Also, the redial isn't reliable. Sometimes it works fine. Other times, it leaves off the area code, which is essential here.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. William H. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive phone, but not for me
customer_reviews.text: The phone doesn't have a speaker phone. I just assumed that even the most basic phones these days would have a speaker phone. My fault for not checking that. So am not deducting any points for that. But the max volume on the phone is very low. Too late to return it now. But I'd keep that in mind if you are looking for a phone. Otherwise the phone is fine. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Milind Rao

customer_reviews.title: Great little phone
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other reviewers, I've had this phone for a while now and I use it regularly. I haven't experienced any of the battery issues that they have or problems reaching the base, etc. In fact, it has a crazy good battery life compared to other cordless phones I've used in the past. If I had one complaint, it would be that the volume doesn't go up very high. But that's less of a complaint and more of a feature wish. The reviews almost stopped my from buying this phone but I'm really glad I did because it's great at this price point for what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: CtryBy

customer_reviews.title: sweet
customer_reviews.text: i like it it works well for me but the instructions users guide is in small print but the phone is great & you can't beat the price good price i think
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hansen

customer_reviews.title: LCD screen dim
customer_reviews.text: do not be deceived by the illustration that shows the LCD screen bright green and readable - mine is virtually grey - cannot be set brighter - the keypad lights up fine - makes no sense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good portable phones
customer_reviews.text: These phones have a long life, good sound and construction qualities and easy to take from place to place. We have had 3 of them and the only reason we had to get new ones was that some of the numbers on the pad wore out and would not work. They are also very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: auntiejae

customer_reviews.title: They don't last long
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 of these on my e4ad telephone shelf in my office. I kept thinking it would get better so I continued ordering another then another, even to different models. They worked for a while then all of. sudden start up wit the "no power at base" and "out of range." I've spent a few hours on their website trying to figure it out with no luck. It is essential that I have a landline, so my next purchase will be a Panasonic. No disrespect intended, but this VTech is not the first Chines product I've had this type of problem with. I will be. buying American on everything from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Niksnanc

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great portable land line phone
customer_reviews.text: It had all the features I wanted, except a hands-free speaker phone capability. I would have given it 5 stars except for this issue. There have been many phone calls with a talk duration of 30 minutes or more and it has lasted that long on a charge, don't know how long it would have lasted. Not had it long enough to evaluate the overall battery life.
customer_reviews.author: keng98

customer_reviews.title: Voice Mail Notification not working
customer_reviews.text: You Know the familiar beep, beep that you get when there is a message waiting in your voice mailbox. I spent over one hour with my telephone service provider trying to figure out why I had no notification of a voice mail. After discontenting the V-TECH MODEL: CS- 6114 problem solved ..........
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: The buttons stick after awhile.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is just a basic one. It doesn't come with an answering system or even an option to put the phone on speaker but I was fine with that. What I'm not fine with is having the buttons stick and not work after having the phone for less than a year. I had to press very hard on some buttons to get them to work and then they would stick and I would end up with half a dozen of whatever number I was punching in.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly good as a phone, but the user interface is poor.
customer_reviews.text: Phones really shouldn't require an operating manual. It shouldn't be hard to figure out how to retrieve voicemail. There's no excuse for vaguely labeled buttons. The user interface is exactly what Steve Jobs fought against at Apple. It feels more like a prototype than a completed product. It's possible to perform any function you want - as long as you're holding the user manual and have plenty of patience. But no competent engineer would have intentionally created this tangled mess of functionality, with these confusing labels and menus. On the other hand, the phone works just fine mechanically and electronically. It's light. It holds a charge. The range seems good. And it's really inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Grebner

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. I bought it to put on my bedside nightstand. Everything about it works great. The ringer is easy to hear but not to loud. The volume is great. It has all the features more expensive phones have. The only thing it doesn't have is a speaker. But I don't need a speaker phone in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t make it work.
customer_reviews.text: I have to rate this real low because I didn’t know how to set it up. I thought as soon as I plugged it in it would work but it did not and I figured out how to put it with the Wi-Fi thing but it still didn’t work. I have it here but I can’t use it. For people who are new to the new age equipment and lifestyle it would be good if you could put some step-by-step concepts or pictures so that setting the telephone up to work would not be so so hard.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Floyd-Golden

customer_reviews.title: Great priced and functional land line
customer_reviews.text: The phone was great for my grandma, who else uses land lines in the 21st century. Only issue was accordingly the keys were too small
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I need a battery replacement
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this phone with 1 bar on the battery and I charge it for 6 hours and it's still at 1 bar I then charge it up to 24 hours and it's still at 1 bar, I tried to contact the seller to arrange how I can get a next battery for it and I cant find the option to contact them. The quality of the volume is good and the phone itself is modern and stylish but only the battery not charging when it plug in the bars are running up and down as if its charging but when take off the charger it's still at one bar. I need a battery replacement
customer_reviews.author: Danito Fullwood

customer_reviews.title: I really like this phone
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone. My favorite thing about it is, you can scroll the caller ID, then just press 1 to call the number back. With my old phone, it wouldn't let you add 1, and then the call wouldn't go through. You'd have to write the number down just to call it back! It also has a nice display that lets you know when you have missed a call or have a new voice mail. I like the background display and button colors, that light up and make it easier to see. It's a nice, ergonomic design, easy to hold. The battery lasts a long time and charges quickly. Overall, very pleased with this phone.
customer_reviews.author: RZK

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The phone itself is so lightweight, it doesn't feel like anything is on the inside. Maybe that's good?? What I don't like is that the screen doesn't light up enough so that I can read the caller ID. I wear glasses and even with them on, I can't read it. The process of settings is difficult and I just finally gave up getting it set up to my preference. It's just ok.
customer_reviews.author: LadyC

customer_reviews.title: NEW not a good choice
customer_reviews.text: I just received it! Now that I have it for a couple of days. First the screen is so poorly lite it is UN-useable. You have to push the off and on hook buttons need to be pushed twice to function. You hear a beep when you push the button but need to push it a second time to connect or disconnect a call. Very poor sound quality
customer_reviews.author: Spike Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Wireless Phone and Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This stand alone phone works perfectly. I have the same brand for over 6 yrs without any problems. Clear voice, both ways. Nice little screen for caller ID and its functions. Programming the contacts and phones it's easy but go slows reading instructions and quickly will get the hang of it. Should fully charge battery before you go on and this took me a bout 45 min or a little more. No regrets on this one.
customer_reviews.author: rlcamazon

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Just the basic features, which is all I need as I rarely use my landline, and my voicemails are taken care of by my carrier. I shows if you have voicemails and battery level. I've had a conversation long enough to see the battery indicate go down. The sound quality is fine.
customer_reviews.author: TomNewYork

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit exsisting wall mount.
customer_reviews.text: I returned this phone because it did not fit my existing wall mount bracket. It came with a long phone line cord not the short one needed for wall mounting. The screen push buttons light up but not the screen which made it difficult to read the rather small numbers. The overall quality of the actual phone appears to be very good it just didn't meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dave T.

customer_reviews.title: Not for seniors
customer_reviews.text: This 80-year-old guy had a hard time reading the small, dimly-lit screen on this phone, which made it difficult to set up. I also realized how much I have relied on a handset's speaker phone option to improve hearing; this phone does not have a speaker phone.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hammer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: i keep in the stand after each uses. So don't know how long the battery will last just left off it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay S

customer_reviews.title: Low quality and no mute or speaker function.
customer_reviews.text: This phone does not have a mute or speaker function. It is very basic. It also does not hold a charge for a long period of time. It also doesn't give very good sound quality. I suppose that's why it is so low price. I wish I would have looked a little further into the details because I really hate having a phone without speaker or mute functions. It does have caller ID etc. but it's very difficult to scroll through. I honestly would not recommend this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: reasonably priced cordless phone
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this phone. It works well and is great at about $12. Don't remember how long I had the first, but needed another as buttons were starting to stick and the display was disappearing. Worth the money if you only need one cordless rather than a set.
customer_reviews.author: Mug2You

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Had to get a house phone cause it came with the cable an internet package The phone was not charged when it came so I thought it was broken so left it charge for a while it still didn't work but it turned on so the stupid cable ppl didn't turn my voice services on but was charging me for it lol but it's a good phone very clear not very loud ring but it's cool for the price
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: DISPLAY IS INADEQUATE
customer_reviews.text: We bought this phone expecting a bright easy to read display. It is dim and hard to see. The adjustable volume and clarity if very good. The other frustration is no indication there are messages waiting. It's an excellent phone if you don't care about these features.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gray

customer_reviews.title: I might replace it.
customer_reviews.text: You know how your fingers can just dance along some telephone keypads? Like, beep beep bip boop beep? This one is Squish wait Beep, Squish wait Beep, Squish wait Bip, Squish wait boop... seriously, it takes forever to enter a phone number. I mean, it's a phone, it makes calls, is missing a few features I like but I was never promised those features anyway, has great backlighting; but really. Drives me nuts to have to press each button so firmly and then wait until the phone recognizes that I've pressed the button.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Ellen Sherblom

customer_reviews.title: Cheapest and Sturdiest Portable Phone of all time!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a Boys and Girls Club. At first we were worried about the lack of a speakerphone and it's durability. I found two others that had ordered it and after a year they still liked it. Didn't think it would hold up with the kids. So far so good! The range on the thing is also oustanding. They can walk outside to the curb while talking on it. The price performance ratio is out of this world!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D. Uecker

customer_reviews.title: I am unable to set up a directory. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I am unable to set up a directory. I don't have a problem entering the numbers but I can't put in the name. When try to put in the name JAY I don't have a problem with the J or A but I can't put in the y. I can't figure out why it won't advance to the y but keeps putting in a w. I have other phones and the directions are the same for putting in a name. I should be able to tap the 9 three times and get a y but it will only keep putting w. What am I doing wrong? I wish I had bought a different phone.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Lowrance

customer_reviews.title: Poor Display
customer_reviews.text: The lighting on the display is so bad I needed a flashlight to see. I ordered 1 and had it replaced only to find that the 2nd one had the same problem. I returned them both and ordered a Panasonic which is great! The Panasonic was twice the price. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry W. Benningfield

customer_reviews.title: Very affordable, works fine, kinda light/flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone because my parents' other one was quite old, and replacing the battery, if I could even find one, wouldn't be worth the hassle or price. The handset and stand/charger are very light and plastic-y, probably wouldn't withstand accidental falls, but so far they've not dropped it, and it works fine as a second phone in the house.
customer_reviews.author: HissyFitz

customer_reviews.title: Lighting awful to see who called/calling
customer_reviews.text: I realize the cost and it's a landline I was hoping to at least read the Caller ID screen. This was simply to replace my wireless phone that died. I have had V-Tech before and never a real issue. The numbers do not light up well at all and buttons tough to push even.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 30 days before the keypad stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice, simple telephone, without any extra items to confuse mom (she has dementia). Yesterday, all of the buttons "froze" and the phone was stuck with the keypad lit up. The only way to stop the key pad from staying alight was to remove the battery. All of the buttons stopped working EXACTLY 1 day past return deadline! So, we got less than 30 days of use out of the phone before it died. I am very disappointed in this product and will not buy another V-Tech phone.
customer_reviews.author: Bkind2oldfolksW/Alz

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for; keep looking
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize there was no speaker button on this phone. I hate that especially since the volume isn't very loud even turned all the way up. The ringer isn't very loud either. I wanted to return it but can't figure out how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: B Butts

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play, white phone with black cabling
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special about this phone. it is just as I ordered with the exception of the power cable and telephone cable, which are black and not white like I thought they were going to be. Also only came with a long telephone line and not an appropriate sized cable to use with the wall mount feature. Wall mounting is difficult as well.
customer_reviews.author: MH in SATX

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 10 year old. She wanted a cell phone so this was our compromise. It takes a little to figure out all of the functions on this phone. It is not exactly user friendly. My 10 yr old figured it out though with some help. She talks on it for hours at a time, and hasn't had it go dead yet. She only charges it every other day just to make sure that it stays charged.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Price

customer_reviews.title: Do not adjust the volume; you may never have it back
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect phone for what I wanted; priced perfect, small/compact with good-enough battery life. Two weeks in, I decided to adjust the ring volume to low, and it worked. However 24 hrs later, the phone went MUTE. The only clue to a call was the phone lighting up. I've tried all but the phone remains mute with no ring tone so far. stay away
customer_reviews.author: Dzagal

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad.
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to dial. You need to press very hard, otherwise it will not take. Now after 2 months since I bought it, the number FIVE does not click, rendering the phone totally USELESS. This is the worst phone I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Villareal

customer_reviews.title: LCD Font too small, backlight too dim
customer_reviews.text: Most features of this phone are on par with other phones in this price range and class. Buttons are nice and well backlit. The LCD is the biggest weak spot. It is difficult to read in all lighting mostly because of the small font size, small LCD screen, poor font positioning (first number is hidden in shadow of bezel) and dim backlighting. Panasonic does a much better job with the LCD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WTF!
customer_reviews.text: I unplugged the battery and it just stopped working! Im so upset right now I am so tired of e-waste. up-date The phone does work but the battery only holds a charge for a few hours so its that useful.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Save your coins on this one
customer_reviews.text: Biggest piece of crap. U get what you pay for I guess. Cheaply made and sounds horrible
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The screen is too small and too dim. The text it displays is too small. I am sorry I did not return this phone for a refund. The best attribute of this handset is its low price. I read the 45-page user manual. Ugh. Whoever designed the user interface must get a better education.
customer_reviews.author: Mehetabelle

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for cheap and mediocre quality buy this.
customer_reviews.text: It’s cheap and performs as such. We wanted a landline just for emergencies. It does that. It’s uncomfortable to hold and dialing is oddly s l o w. You sound farther away than with a mobile phone. Again, if it’s only going to be used sporadically it’s the perfect phone.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Am I going blind?
customer_reviews.text: To see the screen you will need to go into a dark room with all the lights off and at night. Even indoors with all lights of but natural sunlight coming into the room, you will have to cover the screen with your hand in order to see it. The screen back-lighting very, very weak. Costs $13.59, worth $0.59.
customer_reviews.author: John Houston

customer_reviews.title: Clearly not new
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a phone because we continue to have a landline for many reasons. The phone was clearly an open box return, even though no where in the description of the item does it indicate that. However, the half-attempted removed "Kohl's" label was a give away, as was the missing components, which we will use from our previous phone. We decided to keep it since it's a basic phone and it was cheap and it works, but it just shows how little integrity some of these sellers have.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great Cordless Phone
customer_reviews.text: We had an older model of this cordless phone that was not DECT 6.0. The buttons finally just didn't work anymore, so we liked it so much, we got the newer model. It works great & really has good range. I can carry it to the pool or to the garden & still get great reception. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Old faithful
customer_reviews.text: This order replaced an old one hit by lightning. I can't recall how old the first one was, but it had new batteries). A year later, the battery in this new unit is still fantastic, and I can use it while in the yard, at least 100 feet away (just like the old one).
customer_reviews.author: hotchas

customer_reviews.title: No speaker phone
customer_reviews.text: Very Basic.... This is a very basic stripped down VTech cordless phone. A big problem is that you can't use speaker phone with this. I use my phone for work and often need speaker phone as I'm typing and it's not comfortable to constantly hold the phone between your head and neck. Seems like such a simple thing but it's a huge problem for someone like me. I guess I assumed all phones had "speaker phone" capability but I was obviously wrong. The buttons are also a little bit awkward and hard to push
customer_reviews.author: jland

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to buy a cordless phone because I thought that the volume would not be consistent, that it would lower or drop out. The vtech is good. It's nice to talk to someone on the other end of the line and not be restricted to moving around while talking. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: anthony carr

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I wish theres zero stars. I have two of these phones, one stopped working after about 6 mo and the other just after 3 months. We almost not using it as mostly cells are used
customer_reviews.author: Alina Platonova

customer_reviews.title: i loved the phone
customer_reviews.text: I loved the phone, the color, good price and easy to install :)
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a landline phone if you need one.
customer_reviews.text: Not really much to say. It's a cordless landline phone. Bright, clear screen. Responsive buttons. Sturdy built. We just needed to be able to call out just in case our cellphones were low on charge. Perfect price for us.
customer_reviews.author: Anakalia - Red Herring

customer_reviews.title: Bad choice
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the range for this phone. Bought this as a gift for my son. Poor signal quality even inside a 1500 sq. ft. house. Audio is has static unless he's standing right beside the base unit. Not recommended, and I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: way2practical

customer_reviews.title: great value, great functionality, trouble free but basic
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality, low cost phone for home. The ringer is adjustable and loud enough to heart rom adjoining rooms. The sound quality and microphone on calls are both great and feels comfortable against the ear on long calls, unlike a lot of more expensive handsets. The range is great and more than adequate. I've used this 80ft from the base unit in my yard and had no issues with call quality. The functions are basic and feel a little dated, but then it's a low cost product. It's durable, functions very well and has been problem free. Not the prettiest, but it's a phone so no complaints. Would recommend highly as a quality budget option.
customer_reviews.author: MrGraingerPA

customer_reviews.title: NEED A NEAT LITTLE PHONE
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and inexpensive little phone. I tried one and then I purchased two more. They seem to be very dependable and easy to use. That is important to us old folks. I would highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Phone
customer_reviews.text: Good phone but isn’t the greatest. I keep one around hooked to an internet phone line so I can make calls when cell reception isn’t great or down. This phone works, but doesn’t seem to be as nice as the one I had a decade ago that finally died.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It works and it was affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and range is good. Plug and play. Holds a charge pretty well. If the battery dies you'll hear a little chirping similar to that of a smoke detector battery alarm just not quite as loud and annoying LOL Next day shipping which is AMAZING!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: No frills phone that works fine
customer_reviews.text: Handy, basic, no frills phone. I got the version without the answering machine because my landline service includes voice mail already. That saved about $8.50 on the purchase. Works fine. Good coverage throughout a small, single story house of 1100 square feet, plus the cellar and garage.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence WalshTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great little phone, simple but good quality
customer_reviews.text: I needed a landline phone for use when my parents visit from Canada. This phone was inexpensive but is good quality and works just great. My only wish, is that it had speaker phone, but for this price I won't complain!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: I decided not to keep this, tho I've used the same product before. There was no problem with it, the price was good. My other phone had not been working correctly and I managed to fix it, so returned this one. But this is a good product for those who need it as a landline. Simple to use, serves the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: K. N.

customer_reviews.title: Basic, reliable cordless phone
customer_reviews.text: When looking for a basic cordless phone, I had two requirements. One was finding one from a manufacturer that I trust. The other was finding one that wasn't laden with "features" for which I have no use. This phone was the answer. Not surprisingly, the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: T Hull

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, basic phone
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy-to-use phone. The handset is lightweight and has a battery pack the size of two AAA batteries. There isn't much bulk to it, which makes it a little hard to hold it with your chin and shoulder without using hands. It has adjustable volume, mute, redial, and flash. It is easy to set the handset into the base and to feel that it is set in there properly so it'll charge. The white is quite white. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: J. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: It'll due I suppose
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep it I suppose. I wanted a cheap phone and got it. It crackles sometimes when on a call. Its volume is not loud enough to hear the other person, it doesnt have a speakerphone button and the battery dies after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Poor display, poor battery life, poor audio from tiny hole
customer_reviews.text: This phone was very disappointing: Display was very tiny and almost impossible to read through a super-glossy plastic window. Battery life wasn't consistent. Sometimes it sat on charge 12+ hrs. but wouldn't get through the next day with hardly any use. Poor audio from the tiny speaker hole. It was so bad, I sent it back and got out my 20+ year old Toshiba phone.
customer_reviews.author: Quality Manager Guy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what was desired ---- a Functional Telephone.
customer_reviews.text: I'll always have a landline as technology has progressed beyond mans ability to keep up with it and, get so tired of having to charge devises. For the price, so far this phone does more than I actually "need", and it's respectfully simple. Not the most pleasant ringtones but hey, we have all gone silly with these nonsensical sounds .....I miss the original telephone "ring". If it lasts a year, I'm happy.......had another brands same version & it made it 7 years so, we are optimistic. No real downside-----it's a "healthy telephone". (Those under age 30 can Google telephone).
customer_reviews.author: Kim Dennis

customer_reviews.title: I can't call everyone I want...
customer_reviews.text: This phone is okay and its features are, for the money, fine. My one issue is the keypad is bad. When I press "3" it doesn't take and this reminded of the old Steven Wright joke where he said he "can't call everyone he wants." I can actually with a very hard keypress get a 3, but it's quite annoying especially when dealing with automated systems that require heavy keypad interaction.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mario T. Lanza

customer_reviews.title: Affordable choice if you just want a good basic home phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone isn't exactly spectacular but works well. We use it with our Obihai 200 (free home phone with google voice) and it does the job. For the most part, my elementary aged child uses it to call friends and relatives using the speed dial. The buttons are easy to press and its easy to program numbers into. The range is great. It easily reaches all the way across my house between floors and through multiple plaster walls. The only downside is that it doesn't have any kind of voicemail features but for us, we don't really want voicemail on a home phone.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kids to have a house phone to call me while I was at work. It broke and I had to exchange it a month after I got it. So far the new one is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work good. The old unit I had worked well for many years but a lack of grace on my part -- I dropped it one too many times -- meant I needed a replacement. My one complaint with this unit (otherwise I'd have given it 5 stars) is that it doesn't have an indicator if you have a voicemail. My old VTech phone had a light.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Samford

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Barely had this phone a month and the battery is already dead and won't charge. Literally made less than 20 calls incoming and outgoing in its entire life. Garbage, don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Being Number Two

customer_reviews.title: Features lacking but a good phone
customer_reviews.text: It is a very basic phone and the price was right. The phone has a display that needs bright light to be seen clearly. There is no speaker phone capability. Despite its short Cummings the phone is well suited for use on my google voice account.
customer_reviews.author: Tjecontact

customer_reviews.title: No Frills, Simple Phone
customer_reviews.text: Basic non frills phone. The thing I miss the most is that it has no speaker phone option and seems like there is a bit of a delay when the buttons are depressed. But for the price it fits the need. UPDATE JULY 2016. This unit quit charging. It appears that the port that the cord plugs into became loose and i'm guessing it no-longer makes contact on the inside. Unit was disposed of and I replaced it with a different manufacture that had a speaker phone.
customer_reviews.author: MattO.

customer_reviews.title: V-tech cordless phone l
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability tohave the phone with you at all times instead of rushing to you corded phone. I can take it with me if the callerneeded information you need to get to. Also, I cann let my friends in a secured building,instead of rushing to a landline To open the door. I like this phone very uch.
customer_reviews.author: Alice D Carty

customer_reviews.title: Cute phone but have a battery issue  ( UPDATED REVIEW)
customer_reviews.text: started using mine a day ago. So far so good. The fone is sleek slim an pretty cool. Calls are loud an crystal clear!!! Only thing tho it should have been offered in different colors an the phone book should store more than 30 but other than than. Its a great price for a great buy!! Only hope no issues after this reviews!! #KnockOnWood!! UPDATED REVIEW I repurchase this exact phone becuz my neighbour liked it, ots a cute phone dont get me wrong but i have to drop from a 5 stars to 3 stars, i realise the battery doesnt stay that long and i hardly talk on my home phone i mostly on my cell
customer_reviews.author: Starr Roberts

customer_reviews.title: My mom love it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone for my mother because her previous phone made her sound like she was in a tunnel when we talked. This new phone is so clear for both her and me. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: lukinagin

customer_reviews.title: Screen is difficult to see
customer_reviews.text: The features on this phone are fine. Everything works as described. No complaints there. Tha manual gives clear and concise instructions for programming the features. I have only one issue with this phone but it's a big one for me - the screen is difficult to see. The lettering is definitely not as dark as the picture shows and the backlighting just isn't sufficient. It also has to do with the way the light reflects off the screen in regular daylight or under lamp light. If the screen up to a better standard this phone would great.
customer_reviews.author: PrimoCat

customer_reviews.title: BEST PHONE ON THE MARKET FOR ITS LOW PRICE!!
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat these phones for the money.. the sound clear, the battery last for about a week if just answering quick calls at home.. most of us barely use our phones these days with out cells but if you want that perfect quality sound you get on a landline..
customer_reviews.author: Jay Micale "Hawk" Professional Pool Player & Instructor for Daytonajay Billiards LLC, Retired ASE Master Auto Technician

customer_reviews.title: Slow buttons
customer_reviews.text: There is a long and slow lag time when pressing the numbers on the pad. You almost have to wait a full second between numbers. That's really frustrating to me. If you dial too fast, you stand the chance of it missing a number and then you have to start all over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: VTech CS6114 DECT 6.0 Cordless Phone with Caller ID/Call Waiting, White/Grey with 1 Handset
product_meta.description: Color:White| Pattern Name:PhoneVTech DECT 6.0 Digital Cordless Phone with Caller ID. As an integrated design manufacturer, we are in full control of what we make and can manage production costs closely. This has made us a world leader in cordless phones and electronic learning toys, and a top 50 electronic manufacturing services provider.
feature_bullets: DECT 6.0 Digital technology, Caller ID/Call Waiting, Backlit keypad and display
30 name and number phonebook directory, 30 name and number Caller ID history, Voicemail Waiting Indicator
For optimal performance batteries should be charged for 16 hours prior to use
DSL Subscribers may need to us a DSL Filter. Speed Dial, Phonebook, Mute, Flash Function
No Answering Device in the phone. No Speaker Phone. Refer to product description below for additional Cordless Phone features.Trilingual Menu Support (English / Spanish / French)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars10,745 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
